result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sade A Shirwa

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sade A Shirwa in court with attorney Kat Mcclain.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

THIS COURT RECORD COVERS CASES 16CM156, 16CM184 and 16CM230

16CM156
Count #3:  State moves to dismiss and read in.  Court grants.

16CM184
Count #1:  Defendant pleads guilty.  Court finds defendant guilty.
Pay court costs to include DNA surcharge- 60 days to pay.
15 days jail with credit for 5 days already served, with huber.  Report to jail immediately.
$250 cash posted to apply to costs in this case; if any remainder, apply to costs in 16CM230

16CM230
Count #1:  Defendant pleads guilty.  Court finds defendant guilty.
Count #2:  State moves to dismiss and read in.  Court grants.
Pay court costs to include DNA surcharge - 60 days to pay.
15 days jail to run concurrent with jail time in 16CM184

Order for DNA given to the defendant in court. Report to Barron County Jail immediately.

(clerked by AP)
Defendant Sade A Shirwa in court with attorney Kat Mcclain.  Rachel Kibbe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  THIS COURT RECORD COVERS CASES 16CM184 and 16CM156

This hearing is on defense' motion to amend bond(s) to delete the PBT requirements.  Court grants motion.  All other conditions of previous bond(s) to remain in full force and effect.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.  
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
Must submit to daily PBT's at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept. at 6:00 p.m.

07/06/2016 AMENDED: DEFENDANT IS EXCUSED FROM SUBMITING TO HIS DAILY PBT ON JULY 6 AND JULY 7, 2016. ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN IN FULL FORCE AND EFFECT.

AMENDED 8/11/16:  PBT requirements are deleted.  All other previously ordered conditions remain in full force and effect.

Defendant Sade A Shirwa in court with attorney Kat Mcclain.  Rachel Kibbe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COURT RECORD COVERS 16CM156, 16CM184 AND 16CM230.
Reset.
Bond to continue.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 24, 2016 at 02:00 pm

(clerked by DN)
Defendant Sade A Shirwa in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  John Michael O'Boyle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

16CM156, 16CM184, 16CM230

State relates.

If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.  
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
Must submit to daily PBT's at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept. at 6:00 p.m.

07/06/2016 AMENDED: DEFENDANT IS EXCUSED FROM SUBMITING TO HIS DAILY PBT ON JULY 6 AND JULY 7, 2016. ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN IN FULL FORCE AND EFFECT.

Defendant Sade A Shirwa in court with attorney Ryan W O'Hara.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant qualifies for PD representation. Defendant to provide the Clerk of Court's with his phone number. Defendant waives further reading of Complaint and pleads NG.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 20, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
